thread.title: East Chicago man dead, woman wounded in Gary shooting
thread.title_full: East Chicago man dead, woman wounded in Gary shooting

author: Becky Jacobs
title: East Chicago man dead, woman wounded in Gary shooting

organizations.name: lake county sheriff crime scene investigations

text:
East Chicago man dead, woman wounded in Gary shooting Becky Jacobs Post-Tribune Privacy Policy 
A woman was injured and an East Chicago man was killed in an early morning shooting in Gary, according to releases from Gary police and the Lake County coroner. 
Gary police were called to the 300 block of McKinley Street about 1:35 a.m. Friday for a report of shots fired, according to a release, where they found the two gunshot victims. A 29-year-old woman, who police did not identify, was taken to an area hospital for treatment, according to Gary police. 
The coroner's office declared the man, identified as 36-year-old Ajonte J. Griffin, of the 4200 block of Kennedy Avenue in East Chicago, dead at the scene. His death was ruled a homicide, the release states. 
"The investigation is still in its early stages and detectives are currently following up on leads," Lt. Dawn Westerfield said in a release. 
Anyone with information is asked to call Detective Kristopher Adams of the Lake County/Gary Metro Homicide Unit at 219-755-3855 or the crime tip line at 866-CRIME-GP. 
Lake County Sheriff Crime Scene Investigations and Gary fire also responded to the scene.
